Introduction

Welcome to the Stoker (short form: STKR) Bootstrap/HTML 5 template documentation. Thanks for buying it!

Here are some important questions (and answers) to start with:

What is STKR: STKR is a modern and lightweight commercial HTML template made for developers and webdesigners to create smaller static websites like landingpages, portfolio pages, CV sites etc. It based on HTML5/CSS3 and the responsive grid framework Bootstrap (SASS version) and comes with Bower and Gulp support. It is a toolbox with different snippets to be combined by you to a great looking (and working...) website.

What is it not: It is not a WordPress theme nor another CMS template! It is not a full and ready-made website.

What is all this Gulp, Bower, Bootstrap stuff? Do I need any advanced rocket sience degree to use this template? No, if you don´t have a clue what this is all about just don´t care about the /dev folder in the templates ZIP archive. Just use the /template_itself folder and you are good to go. In this case you just need some basic HTML and CSS knowledge to create a website based on STKR. But if you are a professional frontend developer you probably love all this s*#!t. In this case take a look at the /dev folder

1.

Installation

Its very easy to install STKR. You just need a bit of webspace plus a FTP tool.

Check out the HTML file locally

First of all: Extract the downloaded stkr.zip file to your local HDD. It includes two folder: /dist and /dev. At this point: Don´t care about the /dev folder.
The /the_template_itself/index.html file is your main HTML file. You can open it on your local computer. Just double click on it and your favorite browser will open STKR.

Upload the template to your webspace

Just upload the contens (all files and folders) from INSIDE the /the_template_itself folder via FTP to your webspace. Tatatata! Thats it...your website is online.

2.

Developer Stuff

Okay, I can´t give you a basic introduction to SASS, Bower and Gulp at this point. Read on if you are familiar with it. If not take some time, Google it, learn it and enjoy it! And if you don´t enjoy it: No fear, you can use this template without all this blingbling stuff. It just takes a bit more time...

Install npm, Bower, SASS and Gulp n your computer at first.
Then open you terminal and go to the: 

/dev
folder inside the extracted STKR folder.

Run: 

 $ npm install
that installes all the gulp dependencies. Than type: 
$ bower install
to install all the frontend dependencies. Than everything should be there and you are ready to go.

3.

Assets and Credits

STKR uses a lot of 3rd party scripts and assets. Here is a lit of it:

  • jQuery 2.1.3 - Okay I don´t think I have to say something about it...
  • Bootstrap 3.3.4 (SASS ported version)- CSS Grid Framework - Visit getbootstrap.com to learn more about it.
  • Owl Carousel Slider 2 - Visit the authors website
  • Skrollr scrolling script - By Prinzhorn
  • CC Zero licensed images from Unsplash and deathtostockphotos
